Typedef Documentation

◆ REGEXPR_COMPARE

typedef int(* REGEXPR_COMPARE) (SXML_CHAR *str, SXML_CHAR *pattern)

The prototype used by the regular expression handler. The default regex function can be overriden by user code through XMLSearch_set_regexpr_compare().

Parameters
strThe string to match on pattern.
patternThe pattern to match str to.
Returns
true if str matches pattern.

◆ XMLSearch

typedef struct _XMLSearch XMLSearch

XML search parameters. Can be initialized from an XPath string.

◆ regstrcmp()

int regstrcmp ( SXML_CHAR *  str,
SXML_CHAR *  pattern 
)

Checks whether a string corresponds to a pattern.

Parameters
strThe string to check.
patterncan use wildcads such as * (any potentially empty string) or ? (any character) and use \ as an escape character.
Returns
true when str matches pattern, false otherwise.

◆ XMLNode_get_XPath()

SXML_CHAR* XMLNode_get_XPath ( XMLNode *  node,
SXML_CHAR **  xpath,
int  incl_parents 
)

Get node XPath-like equivalent: tag[.="text", @attribute="value", ...], potentially including father nodes XPathes.

The computed XPath is stored in a dynamically-allocated string.

Returns
the XPath, or NULL if node is invalid or on memory error.

◆ XMLSearch_free()

int XMLSearch_free ( XMLSearch *  search,
int  free_next 
)

Free all search members except for the search->next member that should be freed by its creator, unless free_next is true.

It is recommended that free_next is positioned to true only when the creator did not handle the whole memory allocation chain, e.g. when using XMLSearch_init_from_XPath() that allocates all search structs.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters.
free_nextfalse in order not to free the search->next structures.
Returns
false when search is NULL.

◆ XMLSearch_get_XPath_string()

SXML_CHAR* XMLSearch_get_XPath_string ( const XMLSearch *  search,
SXML_CHAR **  xpath,
SXML_CHAR  quote 
)

Compute an XPath-equivalent string of the search criteria.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters. NULL will return an empty string.
xpathis a pointer to a string that will be allocated by the function and should be freed after use.
quoteis the quote character to be used (e.g. " or ‘’‘). If ’\0', XML_DEFAULT_QUOTE will be used.
Returns
false for a memory problem, true otherwise.

◆ XMLSearch_init()

int XMLSearch_init ( XMLSearch *  search)

Initialize an empty search. No memory freeing is performed.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters.
Returns
false when search is NULL.

◆ XMLSearch_init_from_XPath()

int XMLSearch_init_from_XPath ( const SXML_CHAR *  xpath,
XMLSearch *  search 
)

Initialize a search struct from an XPath-like query. "XPath-like" means that it does not fully comply to XPath standard.

Parameters
xpathshould be like "tag[.=text, @attrib="value", @attrib!='value', ...]/tag...". Warning: the XPath query on node text like father[child="text"] should be re-written father/child[.="text"] instead (which should be XPath-compliant as well).
searchThe search parameters.
Returns
true when search was correctly initialized, false in case of memory problem or malformed xpath.

◆ XMLSearch_next()

XMLNode* XMLSearch_next ( const XMLNode *  from,
XMLSearch *  search 
)

Search next matching node, according to search parameters.

Search starts from node from by scanning all its children, and going up to siblings, uncles and so on.

Searching for the next matching node is performed by running the search again on the last matching node. So search has to be initialized by XMLSearch_init() prior to the first call, to memorize the initial from node and know where to stop search. from ITSELF IS NOT CHECKED! Direct call to XMLSearch_node_matches(from, search) should be made if necessary.

If the document has several root nodes, a complete search in the document should be performed by manually calling XMLSearch_next() on each root node in a for loop. Note that search should be the initial search struct (i.e. search->prev should be NULL). This cannot be checked corrected by the function itself as it is partly recursive.

Parameters
fromThe node to start searching from.
searchThe search parameters.
Returns
the next matching node according to search criteria, or NULL when no more nodes match or when an error occurred.

◆ XMLSearch_node_matches()

int XMLSearch_node_matches ( const XMLNode *  node,
const XMLSearch *  search 
)

Check whether a node matches a search criteria.

If search->prev is not NULL (i.e. has a father search), node->father is also tested, recursively (i.e. grand-father and so on).

Parameters
nodeThe node to test. tag_type should be TAG_FATHER or TAG_SELF only.
searchThe search parameters.
Returns
false when node does not match or for invalid arguments, true if node is a match.

◆ XMLSearch_search_add_attribute()

int XMLSearch_search_add_attribute ( XMLSearch *  search,
const SXML_CHAR *  attr_name,
const SXML_CHAR *  attr_value,
int  value_equal 
)

Add an attribute search criteria.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters.
attr_nameis the attribute name to search. Mandatory.
attr_valueshould be NULL to test for attribute presence only (no test on value). An empty string means the attribute should exist with an empty value.
value_equalshould be specified to test for attribute value equality (true) or difference (false).
Returns
the index of the new attribute, or -1 for memory error.

◆ XMLSearch_search_get_attribute_index()

int XMLSearch_search_get_attribute_index ( const XMLSearch *  search,
const SXML_CHAR *  attr_name 
)

Retrieve attribute search parameters on attribute attr_name.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters.
attr_nameThe attribute name to look for.
Returns
The attribute search index or -1 if not found.

Remove the attribute search parameters by index.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters.
i_attrThe search attribute index.
Returns
the number of search attributes parameters left.

◆ XMLSearch_search_set_children_search()

int XMLSearch_search_set_children_search ( XMLSearch *  search,
XMLSearch *  children_search 
)

Set an additional search on children nodes of a previously matching node.

Search struct are chained to finally return the node matching the last search struct, which father node matches the previous search struct, and so on. This allows describing more complex search queries like XPath "//FatherTag[@attrib=val]/ChildTag/".

In this case, a first search struct would have search->tag = "FatherTag" and search->attributes[0] = { "attrib", "val" } and a second search struct with search->tag = "ChildTag". If children_search is NULL, next search is removed. Freeing previous search is to be performed by its owner. In any case, if search next search is not NULL, it is freed.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters.
children_searchThe search parameters to be applied to children of nodes matching search.
Returns
true when association has been made, false when an error occurred.

◆ XMLSearch_search_set_tag()

int XMLSearch_search_set_tag ( XMLSearch *  search,
const SXML_CHAR *  tag 
)

Set the search based on tag.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters.
tagshould be NULL or empty to search for any node (e.g. search based on attributes only). In this case, the previous tag is freed.
Returns
true upon successful completion, false for memory error.

◆ XMLSearch_search_set_text()

int XMLSearch_search_set_text ( XMLSearch *  search,
const SXML_CHAR *  text 
)

Set the search based on text content.

Parameters
searchThe search parameters.
textshould be NULL or empty to search for any node (e.g. search based on attributes only). In this case, the previous text is freed.
Returns
true upon successful completion, false for memory error.

◆ XMLSearch_set_regexpr_compare()

REGEXPR_COMPARE XMLSearch_set_regexpr_compare ( REGEXPR_COMPARE  fct)

Set a new comparison function to evaluate whether a string matches a given pattern.

The default one is regstrcmp() which handles limited regular expressions ('?' and '*' wildcards).

Returns
The previous function used for matching.
